summary: This document is a consolidated civil docket report from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida, West Palm Beach Division, dated October 28, 2008. It details the procedural history of eight separate civil lawsuits (Jane Doe Nos. 2-7 and two others) filed against Jeffrey Epstein in 2008, alleging personal injury and other claims. The docket entries show motions for default, stays, dismissals, and attempts to seal documents, all presided over by Judge Kenneth A. Marra.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant in all eight civil lawsuits detailed in the docket, accused of personal injury and other violations by multiple Jane Doe plaintiffs.

persons.name: Kenneth A. Marra
persons.context: Presiding judge over the majority of the civil cases against Epstein, issuing orders on motions for default, stays, dismissals, and sealing.

connections.description: Goldberger is listed as defense counsel for Epstein in multiple civil cases, filing motions on his behalf.
Tein is listed as defense counsel for Epstein in multiple civil cases, filing motions and replies.
Critton is listed as defense counsel for Epstein in multiple civil cases, filing motions to dismiss.
Herman is listed as lead attorney for plaintiff Jane Doe No. 2.
Horowitz is listed as lead attorney for plaintiff Jane Doe No. 3.
Reinhart is listed both as a co-defendant and as defense counsel for Epstein in case 9:08cv80811.
Judge Marra presided over the majority of the civil cases, issuing orders directly affecting Epstein's defense.

events.title: First Jane Doe Complaint Filed
events.description: Jane Doe No. 2 files a complaint against Jeffrey Epstein (case 9:08cv80119), initiating the series of civil suits.

events.title: Service of Process on Epstein
events.description: Multiple affidavits indicate Jeffrey Epstein was served with summons and complaints for several cases on this date.

events.title: Clerk's Entry of Default
events.description: The clerk entered default against Jeffrey Epstein in cases 9:08cv80380 and 9:08cv80381 for failure to respond.

events.title: Judge Denies Sealing Motions
events.description: Judge Marra denies Epstein's motions to file documents under seal and orders them unsealed for public inspection.

events.title: Defaults Vacated
events.description: Judge Marra grants motions to set aside the clerk's entries of default against Epstein in two cases.

events.title: Motions to Stay Denied
events.description: Judge Marra denies Epstein's motions to stay the civil proceedings in multiple cases.

events.title: Amended Complaints Filed
events.description: Multiple Jane Doe plaintiffs file amended complaints in their respective cases against Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Jury Trial
events.description: A jury trial is scheduled for January 25, 2010, before Judge Marra for several of the consolidated cases.

locations: U.S. District Court - Florida Southern (West Palm Beach)
New York, NY (9 East 71st Street - Epstein's address)
keyFacts: Eight separate civil lawsuits were filed against Jeffrey Epstein in 2008 by plaintiffs identified as Jane Doe Nos. 2-7 and others.
Epstein's defense team, including Jack Goldberger, Michael Tein, and Robert Critton, repeatedly sought to stay the civil cases, likely referencing a pending federal criminal action.
Judge Kenneth A. Marra consistently denied Epstein's attempts to seal documents and to stay the civil proceedings, ordering filings to be made public.
Default was entered against Epstein in two cases for failure to respond, but these defaults were later vacated by the court.
The cases were consolidated for pre-trial purposes, with a joint jury trial scheduled for January 2010.
